entries.meaning: (slang, US, New York) a homeless person, especially one who sleeps in the New York subway.
examples: Did you see those two skells lying in the doorway?

entries.meaning: (slang, US, New York, police jargon) A male suspicious person or crime suspect, especially a street person such as a drug dealer, pimp or panhandler.

verbs.description: skell (third-person singular simple present skells, present participle skelling, simple past and past participle skelled)

entries.meaning: (slang, intransitive) To fall off or fall over.
examples: She went skelling over on the ice.
